thread.title: Chairman of House Foreign Affairs on Israeli Violence: ‘It Must Stop’
thread.title_full: Chairman of House Foreign Affairs on Israeli Violence: ‘It Must Stop’

author: Ryan Haas
title: Chairman of House Foreign Affairs on Israeli Violence: ‘It Must Stop’
text:
Share Photo credit: Bill Clark | CQ Roll Call 
U.S. Rep. Ed Royce (R-CA), Chairman of the House Foreign Affairs Committee announced on Monday that on Oct. 22, the committee will convene a hearing entitled, “Words Have Consequences: Palestinian Authority Incitement to Violence.” 
The hearing, which comes as a wave of violent attacks continue across Israel, will begin at 10 a.m. 
“The recent wave of attacks in Jerusalem and throughout Israel is very concerning,” Chairman Royce said. “The seeds of this violence have been planted in the minds of young Palestinians by their leaders, who for years have incited hatred, undermining prospects for peace.” 
Royce called for the spate of violence to stop. 
“The Palestinian Authority must fulfill its responsibility to restore calm and the incitement must end,” he added.
